answerText: The Wapshot Chronicle[10] The Wapshot Chronicle is a novel by this author who once taught at the Iowa Writers' Workshop and won the Pulitzer for his self-titled collection, The Stories of this man.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 9 | 3 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, Leander crashes his boat, the S.S. Topaze, which further emasculates him after he has been dependent on his cousin Honora's financial support for some time. [10] Name this novel about the family of Leander and his sons, Moses and Coverly, who live in the fishing village of St. Botolphs.
